Agendas.Anti-Intellectual Revolution.Des.value: Le FOR : After a player researches a technology, they must destroy 1 of their non-fighter ships.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player chooses and exhausts 1 planet for each technology they own.

Agendas.Archived Secret.Description.value: Le Elected player draws 1 secret objective.

Agendas.Armed Forces Standardization.Des.value: Le The elected player places command tokens from their reinforcements so that they have 3 tokens in their tactic pool, 3 tokens in their fleet pool and 2 tokens in their strategy pool. They return any excess tokens to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Arms Reduction.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player destroys all but 2 of their dreadnaughts and all but 4 of their cruisers.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each of their planets that have a technology specialty.

Agendas.Articles of War.Description.value: Le FOR : All mechs lose their printed abilities except for SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "For" gains 3 trade goods.

Agendas.Checks and Balances.Description.value: Le FOR : When a player chooses a strategy card during the strategy phase, they give that strategy card to another player that does not have 1 (or a player that does not have 2 in a three- or four-player game), if able.
AGAINST : Each player readies only 3 of their planets at the end of this agenda phase.

Agendas.Clandestine Operations.Descripti.value: Le FOR : Each player removes 2 command tokens from their command sheet and returns those tokens to their reinforcements.
AGAINST : Each player removes 1 command token from their fleet pool and returns that token to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Classified Document Leaks.Descri.value: Le When this agenda is revealed, if there are no scored secret objectives, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
The elected secret objective becomes a public objective; place it near the other public objectives in the common play area.

Agendas.Colonial Redistribution.Descript.value: Le Destroy each unit on the elected planet.
Then, the player who controls that planet chooses 1 player with the fewest victory points; that player may place 1 infantry from their reinforcements on the elected planet.

Agendas.Committee Formation.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
Before players vote on an agenda that requires a player to be elected, the owner of this card may discard this card to choose a player to be elected. Players do not vote on that agenda.

Agendas.Compensated Disarmament.Descript.value: Le Destroy each ground force on the elected planet; for each unit that was destroyed, the player who controls that planet gains 1 trade good.

Agendas.Conventions of War.Description.value: Le FOR : Players cannot use BOMBARDMENT against units that are on cultural planets.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "Against" discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Core Mining.Description.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
Then, destroy 1 infantry on the planet.
The resource value of this planet is increased by 2.

Agendas.Covert Legislation.Description.value: Le When this agenda is revealed, the speaker draws the next card in the agenda deck but does not reveal it to the other players.

Instead, the speaker reads the eligible outcomes aloud (For, Against, Elect Player, etc.); the other players vote for these outcomes as if they were outcomes of this agenda, without knowing their effects.

Agendas.Demilitarized Zone.Description.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
Then, destroy all units on that planet.
Player's units cannot land, be produced, or be placed on this planet.

Agendas.Economic Equality.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply. Then, each player gains 5 trade goods.
AGAINST : Each player returns all of their trade goods to the supply.

Agendas.Enforced Travel Ban.Description.value: Le FOR : Alpha and beta wormholes have no effect during movement.
AGAINST : Destroy each PDS in or adjacent to a system that contains a wormhole.

Agendas.Executive Sanctions.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player can have a maximum of 3 action cards in their hand.
AGAINST : Each player discards 1 random action card from their hand.

Agendas.Fleet Regulations.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.
AGAINST : Each player places 1 command token from their reinforcements in their fleet pool.

Agendas.Galactic Crisis Pact.Description.value: Le Each player may perform the secondary ability of the elected strategy card without spending a command token; command tokens placed by the ability are placed from a player's reinforcements instead.

Agendas.Holy Planet of Ixth.Description.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The planet's owner gains 1 victory point.
Units on this planet cannot use PRODUCTION.
When a player gains control of this planet, they gain 1 victory point.
When a player loses control of this planet, they lose 1 victory point.

Agendas.Homeland Defense Act.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player can have any number of PDS units on planets they control.
AGAINST : Each player destroys 1 of their PDS units.

Agendas.Imperial Arbiter.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
At the end of the strategy phase, the owner of this card may discard this card to swap 1 of their strategy cards with 1 of another player's strategy cards.

Agendas.Incentive Program.Description.value: Le FOR : Draw and reveal 1 stage I public objective from the deck and place it near the public objectives.
AGAINST : Draw and reveal 1 stage II public objective from the deck and place it near the public objectives.

Agendas.Ixthian Artifact.Description.value: Le FOR : The speaker rolls 1 die. If the result is 6-10, each player may research 2 technologies. If the result is 1-5, destroy all units in Mecatol Rex's system, and each player with units in systems adjacent to Mecatol Rex's system destroys 3 of their units in each of those systems.

Agendas.Judicial Abolishment.Description.value: Le When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
Discard the elected law from play.

Agendas.Minister of Antiques.Description.value: Le The elected player gains 1 relic.

Agendas.Minister of Commerce.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
After the owner of this card replenishes commodities, they gain 1 trade good for each player that is their neighbor.

Agendas.Minister of Exploration.Descript.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card gains control of a planet, they gain 1 trade good.

Agendas.Minister of Industry.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card places a space dock in a system, their units in that system may use their PRODUCTION abilities.

Agendas.Minister of Peace.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
After a player activates a system that contains 1 or more of a different player's units, the owner of this card may discard this card; immediately end the active player's turn.

Agendas.Minister of Policy.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
At the end of the status phase, the owner of this card draws 1 action card.

Agendas.Minister of Sciences.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the "Technology" strategy card, they do not need to spend resources to research technology.

Agendas.Minister of War.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.

The owner of this card may discard this card after performing an action to remove 1 of their command counters from the game board and return it to their reinforcements; then they may perform 1 additional action.

Agendas.Miscount Disclosed.Description.value: Le When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
Vote on the elected law as if it were just revealed from the top of the deck.

Agendas.Mutiny.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player who voted "For" gains 1 victory point.
AGAINST : Each player who voted "For" loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.New Constitution.Description.value: Le When this agenda is revealed, if there are no laws in play, discard this card and reveal another agenda from the top of the deck.
FOR : Discard all laws in play. At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each planet in their home system.

Agendas.Nexus Sovereignty.Description.value: Le FOR : Alpha and beta wormholes in the wormhole nexus have no effect during movement.
AGAINST : Place a gamma wormhole token in the Mecatol Rex system.

Agendas.Political Censure.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card and 1 victory point.
The elected player cannot play action cards.
If the owner of this card loses this card, they lose 1 victory point.

Agendas.Prophecy of Ixth.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
The owner of this card applies +1 to the result of their fighter's combat rolls. When the owner of this card uses PRODUCTION, they discard this card unless they produce 2 or more fighters.

Agendas.Public Execution.Description.value: Le The elected player discards all of their action cards. If they have the speaker token, they give it to the player on their left. The elected player cannot vote on any agendas during this agenda phase.

Agendas.Publicize Weapon Schematics.Desc.value: Le FOR : If any player owns a war sun technology, all players may ignore all prerequisites on war sun technologies. All war suns lose SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
AGAINST : Each player that owns a war sun technology discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Rearmament Agreement.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player places 1 mech from their reinforcements on a planet they control in their home system.
AGAINST : Each player replaces each of their mechs with 1 infantry from their reinforcements.

Agendas.Regulated Conscription.Descripti.value: Le FOR : When a player produces units, they produce only 1 fighter and infantry for its cost instead of 2.

Agendas.Representative Government.Descri.value: Le FOR : Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase. Each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted "Against" exhausts all of their cultural planets.

Agendas.Representative Government.Omega..value: Le FOR : Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase; each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda instead. Players cannot cast additional votes.
AGAINST : At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted "Against" exhausts all of their cultural planets.

Agendas.Research Grant Reallocation.Desc.value: Le The elected player gains any 1 technology of their choice. Then, for each prerequisite on that technology, they remove 1 token from their fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements.

Agendas.Research Team: Biotic.Descriptio.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 green prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Cybernetic.Descri.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 yellow prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Propulsion.Descri.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 blue prerequisite.

Agendas.Research Team: Warfare.Descripti.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
When the owner of this planet researches technology, they may exhaust this card to ignore 1 red prerequisite.

Agendas.Search Warrant.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card and draws 2 secret objectives.
The owner of this card plays with their secret objectives revealed.

Agendas.Seed of an Empire.Description.value: Le FOR : The player with most victory points gains 1 victory point.
AGAINST : The player with the fewest victory points gains 1 victory point.

Agendas.Senate Sanctuary.Description.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The influence value of this planet is increased by 2.

Agendas.Shard of the Throne.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
A player gains this card and 1 victory point when they win a combat against the owner of this card.
Then, the previous owner of this card loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.Shared Research.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player's units can move through nebulae.
AGAINST : Each player places a command token from their reinforcements in their home system, if able.

Agendas.Swords to Plowshares.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player destroys half of their infantry on each planet they control, rounded up. Then, each player gains trade goods equal to the number of their infantry that were destroyed.
AGAINST : Each player places 1 infantry from their reinforcements on each planet they control.

Agendas.Terraforming Initiative.Descript.value: Le Attach this card to the elected planet's card.
The resource and influence values of this planet are increased by 1.

Agendas.The Crown of Emphidia.Descriptio.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
A player gains this card and 1 victory point after they gain control of a planet in the home system of this card's owner.
Then, the previous owner of this card loses 1 victory point.

Agendas.The Crown of Thalnos.Description.value: Le The elected player gains this card.
During each combat round, the owner of this card may reroll any number of dice; they must destroy each of their units that did not produce a hit with its reroll.

Agendas.Unconventional Measures.Descript.value: Le FOR : Each player that voted "For" draws 2 action cards.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "For" discards all of their action cards.

Agendas.Wormhole Reconstruction.Descript.value: Le FOR : All systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole are adjacent to each other.
AGAINST : Each player places a command token from their reinforcements in each system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of their ships.

Agendas.Wormhole Research.Description.value: Le FOR : Each player who has 1 or more ships in a system that contains a wormhole may research 1 technology. Then, destroy all ships in systems that contain an alpha or beta wormhole.
AGAINST : Each player that voted "Against" removes 1 command token from their command sheet and returns it to their reinforcements.

Arborec.Abilities.Mitosis.Description.value: Le Your space docks cannot produce infantry. At the start of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

Arborec.Leaders.Dirzuga Rophal.Descripti.value: Le After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your units that have PRODUCTION:
You may produce 1 unit in that system.

Arborec.Leaders.Dirzuga Rophal.Unlock.value: Le Have 12 ground forces on planets you control.

Arborec.Leaders.Letani Miasmiala.Descrip.value: Le ACTION: Produce any number of units in any number of systems that contain 1 or more of your ground forces.

Arborec.Leaders.Letani Ospha.Description.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose a player's non-fighter ship; that player may replace that ship with one from their reinforcements that costs up to 2 more than the replaced ship

Arborec.Promissories.Stymie.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Arborec player cannot produce units in or adjacent to non-home systems that contain 1 or more of your units.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Arborec player's units, return this card to the Arborec player.

Arborec.Promissories.Stymie.Omega.Descri.value: Le After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units: You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system. Then, return this card to the Arborec player.

Arborec.Techs.Bioplasmosis.Description.value: Le At the end of the status phase, you may remove any number of your infantry from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.

Arborec.Techs.Letani Warrior II.Descript.value: Le After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Arborec.Units.Duha Menaimon.Description.value: Le After you activate this system, you may produce up to 5 units in this system.

Arborec.Units.Letani Behemoth.Descriptio.value: Le DEPLOY: When you would use your MITOSIS faction ability you may replace 1 of your infantry with 1 mech from your reinforcements instead.

Argent Flight.Abilities.Raid Formation.D.value: Le When 1 or more of your units uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, for each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has SUSTAIN DAMAGE to become damaged.

Argent Flight.Abilities.Zeal.Description.value: Le You always vote first during the agenda phase. When you cast at least 1 vote, cast 1 additional vote for each player in the game including you.

Argent Flight.Leaders.Mirik Aun Sissiri..value: Le ACTION: Move any number of your ships from any systems to any number of other systems that contain 1 of your command tokens and no other players' ships.

Argent Flight.Leaders.Trillossa Aun Miri.value: Le When a player produces ground forces in a system:
You may exhaust this card; that player may place those units on any planets they control in that system and any adjacent systems.

Argent Flight.Leaders.Trrakan Aun Zulok..value: Le When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability:
You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.
Le Have 6 units that have ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, SPACE CANNON or BOMBARDMENT on the game board.

Argent Flight.Promissories.Strike Wing A.value: Le When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability:
Choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die
Then, return this card to the Argent player

Argent Flight.Techs.Aerie Hololattice.De.value: Le Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures.
Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION 1 ability as if it were a unit.

Argent Flight.Techs.Strike Wing Alpha II.value: Le When this unit uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, each result of 9 or 10 also destroys 1 of your opponent's infantry in the space area of the active system.

Argent Flight.Units.Aerie Sentinel.Descr.value: Le This unit does not count against capacity if it is being transported or if it is in a space area with 1 or more of your ships that have capacity values.

Argent Flight.Units.Quetzecoatl.Descript.value: Le Other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships in this system.

Barony of Letnev.Abilities.Armada.Descri.value: Le The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.

Barony of Letnev.Abilities.Munitions Res.value: Le At the start of each round of space combat, you may spend 2 trade goods; you may re-roll any number of your dice during that combat round.

Barony of Letnev.Leaders.Darktalon Treil.value: Le ACTION: Place this card near the game board; the number of non-fighter ships you can have in systems is not limited by laws or by the number of command tokens in your fleet pool during this game round.
At the end of that game round, purge this card.

Barony of Letnev.Leaders.Rear Admiral Fa.value: Le After 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE:
Le Have 5 non-fighter ships in 1 system.

Barony of Letnev.Leaders.Viscount Unlenn.value: Le At the start of a Space Combat round:
You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ship in the active system. That ship rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.

Barony of Letnev.Promissories.War Fundin.value: Le At the start of a round of space combat:
The Letnev player loses 2 trade goods.
During this combat round, re-roll any number of your dice.
Then, return this card to the Letnev player.
Le After you and your opponent roll dice during space combat:
You may reroll all of your opponent's dice. You may reroll any number of your dice.
Then, return this card to the Letnev player.

Barony of Letnev.Techs.L4 Disruptors.Des.value: Le During an invasion, units cannot use SPACE CANNON against your units.

Barony of Letnev.Techs.Non-Euclidean Shi.value: Le When 1 of your units uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, cancel 2 hits instead of 1.

Barony of Letnev.Units.Arc Secundus.Desc.value: Le Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD. At the start of each space combat round, repair this ship.

Barony of Letnev.Units.Dunlain Reaper.De.value: Le DEPLOY: At the start of a round of ground combat, you may spend 2 resources to replace 1 of your infantry in that combat with 1 mech.

CKpFBk.value: Le Draw 2 secret objectives and keep 1

Clan of Saar.Abilities.Nomadic.Descripti.value: Le You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.

Clan of Saar.Abilities.Scavenge.Descript.value: Le After you gain control of a planet, gain 1 trade good.

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Captain Mendosa.Des.value: Le After a player activates a system:
You may exhaust this card to increase the move value of 1 of that player's ships to match the move value of the ship on the game board that has the highest move value.

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Gurno Aggero.Descri.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 system that is adjacent to 1 of your space docks. Destroy all other player's infantry and fighters in that system

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Rowl Sarrig.Descrip.value: Le When you produce fighters or infantry:
You may place each of those units at any of your space docks that are not blockaded.

Clan of Saar.Leaders.Rowl Sarrig.Unlock.value: Le Have 3 space docks on the game board.

Clan of Saar.Promissories.Ragh's Call.De.value: Le After you commit 1 or more units to land on a planet:
Remove all of the Saar player's ground forces from that planet and place them on a planet controlled by the Saar player.
Then return this card to the Saar player.

Clan of Saar.Techs.Chaos Mapping.Descrip.value: Le Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.
At the start of your turn during the action phase, you may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has PRODUCTION.

Clan of Saar.Techs.Floating Factory II.D.value: Le This unit is placed in the space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

Clan of Saar.Units.Floating Factory I.De.value: Le This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

Clan of Saar.Units.Scavenger Zeta.Descri.value: Le DEPLOY: After you gain control of a planet, you may spend 1 trade good to place 1 mech on that planet.

Components.Archaeological Expedition.Des.value: Le ACTION: Reveal the top 3 cards of an exploration deck that matches a planet you control; gain any relic fragments that you reveal and discard the rest.

Components.Black Market Forgery.Descript.value: Le ACTION: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic.
Then return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.

Components.Blood Pact.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Components.Cripple Defenses.Description.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 planet. Destroy each PDS on that planet

Components.Dark Pact.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Components.Divert Funding.Description.value: Le ACTION: Return a non-unit upgrade, non-faction technology that you own to your technology deck. Then, research another technology.

Components.Economic Initiative.Descripti.value: Le ACTION: Ready each cultural planet you control.

Components.Enigmatic Device.Description.value: Le ACTION: You may spend 6 resources and purge this card to research 1 technology.

Components.Exploration Probe.Description.value: Le ACTION: Explore a frontier token that is in or adjacent to a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Components.Fabrication.Description.value: Le ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic; or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

Components.Fighter Conscription.Descript.value: Le ACTION: Place 1 fighter from your reinforcements in each system that contains 1 or more of your space docks or units that have capacity; they cannot be placed in systems that contain other players' ships.

Components.Fires of the Gashlai.Descript.value: Le Remove 1 token from the Muaat player's fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, gain your war sun unit upgrade technology card.
Then, return this card to the Muaat player.

Components.Focused Research.Description.value: Le ACTION: Spend 4 trade goods to research 1 technology.

Components.Frontline Deployment.Descript.value: Le ACTION: Place 3 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Components.Gain Relic.Description.value: Le ACTION: Purge 3 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 Relic.

Components.Ghost Ship.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a non-home system that contains a wormhole and does not contain other players' ships.

Components.Impersonation.Description.value: Le ACTION: Spend 3 influence to draw 1 secret objective.

Components.Industrial Initiative.Descrip.value: Le ACTION: Gain 1 trade good for each industrial planet you control.

Components.Insubordination.Description.value: Le ACTION: Remove 1 token from another player's tactic pool and return it to their reinforcements.

Components.Lazax Gate Folding.Descriptio.value: Le ACTION: If you control Mecatol Rex, exhaust this card to place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

Components.Lucky Shot.Description.value: Le ACTION: Destroy 1 dreadnought, cruiser, or destroyer in a system that contains a planet you control.

Components.Mageon Implants.Description.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card to look at another player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.

Components.Mining Initiative.Description.value: Le ACTION: Gain trade goods equal to the resource value of 1 planet you control.

Components.Orbital Drop.Description.value: Le ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Components.Plagiarize.Description.value: Le ACTION: Spend 5 influence and choose a non-faction technology owned by 1 of your neighbors; gain that technology.

Components.Plague.Description.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 planet that is controlled by another player. Roll 1 die for each infantry on that planet. For each result of 6 or greater, destroy 1 of those units.

Components.Production Biomes.Description.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to gain 4 trade goods and choose 1 other player; that player gains 2 trade goods.

Components.Promise of Protection.Descrip.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use their Pillage faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player's units, return this card to the Mentak player.

Components.Reactor Meltdown.Description.value: Le ACTION: Destroy 1 space dock in a non-home system.

Components.Refit Troops.Description.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 or 2 of your infantry on the game board; replace each of those infantry with mechs.

Components.Repeal Law.Description.value: Le ACTION: Discard 1 law from play.

Components.Rise of a Messiah.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on each planet you control.

Components.Scuttle.Description.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 or 2 of your non-fighter ships on the game board and return them to your reinforcements; gain trade goods equal to the combined cost of those ships.

Components.Seize Artifact.Description.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 of your neighbors that has 1 or more relic fragments. That player must give you 1 relic fragment of your choice.

Components.Signal Jamming.Description.value: Le ACTION: Chose 1 non-home system that contains or is adjacent to 1 of your ships. Place a command token from another player's reinforcements in that system.

Components.Sling Relay.Description.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card to produce 1 ship in any system that contains one of your space docks.

Components.Spy.Description.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 player. That player gives you 1 random action card from their hand.

Components.Stall Tactics.Description.value: Le ACTION: Discard 1 action card from your hand.

Components.Star Forge.Description.value: Le ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.

Components.Stymie.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Arborec player cannot produce units in or adjacent to non-home systems that contain 1 or more of your units.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Arborec player's units, return this card to the Arborec player.

Components.Tactical Bombardment.Descript.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 system that contains 1 or more of your units that have Bombardment. Exhaust each planet controlled by other players in that system.

Components.Terraform.Description.value: Le ACTION: Attach this card to a non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex.
Its resource and influence values are each increased by 1 and it is treated as having all 3 planet traits (Cultural, Hazardous, and Industrial).

Components.The Inferno.Description.value: Le ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 cruiser in this unit's system.

Components.Trade Convoys.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player's units, return this card to the Hacan player.

Components.Unexpected Action.Description.value: Le ACTION: Remove 1 of your command tokens from the game board and return it to your reinforcements.

Components.Unstable Planet.Description.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 hazardous planet. Exhaust that planet and destroy up to 3 infantry on it.

Components.Uprising.Description.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust 1 non-home planet controlled by another player. Then gain trade goods equal to its resource value.

Components.Vortex.Description.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose another player's non-structure unit in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your space docks. Capture 1 unit of that type from that player's reinforcements.

Components.War Effort.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place 1 cruiser from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Components.Wormhole Generator.Descriptio.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.

Components.X-89 Bacterial Weapon.Descrip.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose 1 planet in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships that have BOMBARDMENT; destroy all infantry on that planet.

Council Keleres.Abilities.Council Patron.value: Le Replenish your commodities at the start of the strategy phase, then gain 1 trade good.

Council Keleres.Abilities.Law's Order.De.value: Le You may spend 1 influence at the start of your turn to treat all laws as blank until the end of your turn.

Council Keleres.Abilities.The Tribunii.D.value: Le During setup, choose an unplayed faction from among the Mentak, the Xxcha and the Argent Flight; take that faction's home system, command tokens and control markers. Additionally, take the Keleres Hero that corresponds to that faction.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Harka Leeds.Desc.value: Le ACTION: Reveal cards from the action card deck until you reveal 3 action cards that have component actions. Draw those cards and shuffle the rest back into the action card deck

Council Keleres.Leaders.Kuuasi Aun Jalat.value: Le At the start of a round of space combat in a system that contains a planet you control: Place your flagship and up to a total of 2 cruisers and/or destroyers from your reinforcements in the active system.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Odlynn Myrr.Desc.value: Le After an agenda is revealed:
You may cast up to 6 additional votes on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome for this agenda. For each player that votes for another outcome, gain 1 trade good and 1 command token.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Suffi An.Descrip.value: Le After you perform a component action:
You may perform an additional action.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Suffi An.Unlock.value: Le Spend 1 trade good after you play an action card that has a component action.

Council Keleres.Leaders.Xander Alexin Vi.value: You may exhaust this card to allow any player to spend commodities as if they were trade goods.

Council Keleres.Promissories.Keleres Rid.value: Le After an agenda is revealed:
You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 1 action card and gain 2 trade goods.
Then, return this card to the Keleres player.

Council Keleres.Techs.Agency Supply Netw.value: Le Whenever you resolve one of your PRODUCTION abilities, you may resolve an additional one of your PRODUCTION abilities in any system; the additional use does not trigger this ability.

Council Keleres.Techs.I.I.H.Q. Moderniza.value: Le You are neighbors with all players that have units or control planets in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system.
Gain the Custodia Vigilia planet card and its legendary planet ability card. You cannot lose these cards, and this card cannot have an X or Y assimilator placed on it.

Council Keleres.Units.Artemiris.Descript.value: Le Other players must spend 2 influence to activate the system that contains this ship.

Council Keleres.Units.Omniopiares.Descri.value: Le Other players must spend 1 influence to commit ground forces to the planet that contains this unit.

Embers of Muaat.Abilities.Gashlai Physio.value: Le Your ships can move through supernovas.

Embers of Muaat.Abilities.Star Forge.Des.value: Le ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.

Embers of Muaat.Leaders.Adjudicator Ba'a.value: Le After you move a war sun into a non-home system other than Mecatol Rex:

You may destroy all other players' units in that system and replace that system tile with the Muaat supernova tile. If you do, purge this card and each planet card that corresponds to the replaced system tile.

Embers of Muaat.Leaders.Magmus.Descripti.value: Le After you spend a token from your strategy pool:

Embers of Muaat.Leaders.Umbat.Descriptio.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may produce up to 2 units that each have a cost of 4 or less in a system that contains one of their war suns or their flagship

Embers of Muaat.Promissories.Fires of th.value: Le ACTION: Remove 1 token from the Muaat player's fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, gain your war sun unit upgrade technology card. Then, return this card to the Muaat player.

Embers of Muaat.Techs.Magmus Reactor.Des.value: Le Your ships can move into supernovas.
After 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION in a system that either contains a war sun or is adjacent to a supernova, gain 1 trade good.

Embers of Muaat.Techs.Magmus Reactor.Ome.value: Le Your ships can move into supernovas.
Each supernova that contains 1 or more of your units gains the PRODUCTION 5 ability as if it were 1 of your units.

Embers of Muaat.Techs.Prototype War Sun.value: Le Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

Embers of Muaat.Units.Ember Colossus.Des.value: Le When you use your STAR FORGE faction ability in this system or an adjacent system, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements with this unit.

Embers of Muaat.Units.Prototype War Sun.value: Le Other players' units in this system lose PLANETARY SHIELD.

Embers of Muaat.Units.The Inferno.Descri.value: Le ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 cruiser in this unit's system.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Arbiters.Des.value: Le When you are negotiating a transaction, action cards can be exchanged as part of that transaction.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Guild Ships..value: Le You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.

Emirates of Hacan.Abilities.Masters of T.value: Le You do not have to spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the "Trade" strategy card.

Emirates of Hacan.Leaders.Carth of Golde.value: You may exhaust this card to gain 2 commodities or replenish another player's commodities.

Emirates of Hacan.Leaders.Gila the Silve.value: You may spend any number of trade goods; cast 2 additional votes for each trade good spent.

Emirates of Hacan.Leaders.Harrugh Gefhar.value: Le When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION:
You may reduce the cost of each of your units to 0 during this use of PRODUCTION. If you do, purge this card.

Emirates of Hacan.Promissories.Trade Con.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player's units, return this card to the Hacan player.

Emirates of Hacan.Techs.Production Biome.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card and spend 1 token from your strategy pool to gain 4 trade goods and choose 1 other player; that player gains 2 trade goods.

Emirates of Hacan.Techs.Quantum Datahub.value: Le At the end of the strategy phase, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool and give another player 3 of your trade goods. If you do, give 1 of your strategy cards to that player and take 1 of their strategy cards.

Emirates of Hacan.Units.Pride of Kenara..value: Le This planet's card may be traded as part of a transaction; if you do, move all of your units from this planet to another planet you control.

Emirates of Hacan.Units.Wrath of Kenara..value: Le After you roll a die during a space combat in this system, you may spend 1 trade good to apply +1 to the result.

Empyrean.Abilities.Aetherpassage.Descrip.value: Le After a player activates a system, you may allow that player to move their ships through systems that contain your ships.

Empyrean.Abilities.Dark Whispers.Descrip.value: Le During setup, take the additional Empyrean faction promissory note; you have 2 faction promissory notes.

Empyrean.Abilities.Voidborn.Description.value: Le Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.

Empyrean.Leaders.Acamar.Description.value: Le After a player moves ships into a system that does not contain any planets:
You may exhaust this card; that player gains 1 command token.

Empyrean.Leaders.Conservator Procyon.Des.value: Le ACTION: Place 1 frontier token in each system that does not contain any planets and does not already have a frontier token. Then, explore each frontier token that is in a system that contains 1 or more of your ships.

Empyrean.Leaders.Xuange.Description.value: Le After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 of your command tokens:
You may return that token to your reinforcements.

Empyrean.Leaders.Xuange.Unlock.value: Le Be neighbors with all other players.

Empyrean.Promissories.Blood Pact.Descrip.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Empyrean.Promissories.Dark Pact.Descript.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face up in your play area.
When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.

Empyrean.Techs.Aetherstream.Description.value: Le After you or one of your neighbors activates a system that is adjacent to an anomaly, you may apply +1 to the move value of all of that player's ships during this tactical action.

Empyrean.Techs.Voidwatch.Description.value: Le After a player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units, they must give you 1 promissory note from their hand, if able.

Empyrean.Units.Dynamo.Description.value: Le After any player's unit in this system or an adjacent system uses SUSTAIN DAMAGE, you may spend 2 influence to repair that unit.

Empyrean.Units.Watcher.Description.value: Le You may remove this unit from a system that contains or is adjacent to another player's units to cancel an action card played by that player.

Federation of Sol.Abilities.Orbital Drop.value: Le ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Federation of Sol.Abilities.Versatile.De.value: Le When you gain command tokens during the status phase, gain 1 additional command token.

Federation of Sol.Leaders.Claire Gibson..value: Le At the start of a ground combat on a planet you control:
You may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.
Le Control planets that have a combined total of at least 12 resources.

Federation of Sol.Leaders.Evelyn Delouis.value: Le At the start of a ground combat round:
You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ground force in the active system; that ground force rolls 1 additional die during that combat round.

Federation of Sol.Leaders.Jace X. 4th Ai.value: Le ACTION: Remove each of your command tokens from the game board and return them to your reinforcements.

Federation of Sol.Promissories.Military.value: Le At the start of the Sol player's turn:
Remove 1 token from the Sol player's strategy pool, if able, and return it to their reinforcements. Then, you may place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.
Then return this card to the Sol player.

Federation of Sol.Techs.Spec Ops II.Desc.value: Le After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Federation of Sol.Units.Genesis.Descript.value: Le At the end of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements in this system's space area.

Federation of Sol.Units.ZS Thunderbolt M.value: Le DEPLOY: After you use your ORBITAL DROP faction ability, you may spend 3 resources to place 1 mech on that planet.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Creuss Gate.D.value: Le When you create the game board, place the Creuss Gate (tile 17) where your home system would normally be placed. The Creuss Gate system is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 51) in your play area.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Quantum Entan.value: Le You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

Ghosts of Creuss.Abilities.Slipstream.De.value: Le During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains either an alpha or beta wormhole.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Emissary Taivra.value: Le After a player activates a system that contains a non-delta wormhole:
You may exhaust this card; if you do, that system is adjacent to all other systems that contain a wormhole during this tactical action.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Riftwalker Meia.value: Le ACTION: Swap the positions of any 2 systems that contain wormholes or your units, other than the Creuss system and the Wormhole Nexus.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Sai Seravus.Des.value: For each ship that has a capacity value and moved through 1 or more wormholes, you may place 1 fighter from your reinforcements with that ship if you have unused capacity in the active system.

Ghosts of Creuss.Leaders.Sai Seravus.Unl.value: Le Have units in 3 systems that contain alpha or beta wormholes.

Ghosts of Creuss.Promissories.Creuss Iff.value: Le At the start of your turn during the action phase:
Place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
Then, return this card to the Creuss player.

Ghosts of Creuss.Techs.Dimensional Splic.value: Le At the start of space combat in a system that contains a wormhole and 1 or more of your ships, you may produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships.

Ghosts of Creuss.Techs.Wormhole Generato.value: Le At the start of the status phase, place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
Le ACTION: Exhaust this card to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.

Ghosts of Creuss.Units.Hil Colish.Descri.value: Le This ship's system contains a delta wormhole. During movement, this ship may move before or after your other ships.

Ghosts of Creuss.Units.Icarus Drive.Desc.value: Le After any player activates a system, you may remove this unit from the game board to place or move a Creuss wormhole token into this system.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Abilities.Assimilate.Descr.value: Le When you gain control of a planet, replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Abilities.Harrow.Descripti.value: Le At the end of each round of ground combat, your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Leaders.2RAM.Description.value: Le Units that have PLANETARY SHIELD do not prevent you from using BOMBARDMENT.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Leaders.2RAM.Unlock.value: Le Have 4 dreadnoughts on the Board.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Leaders.I48S.Description.value: Le After a player activates a system:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to replace 1 of their infantry in the active system with 1 mech from their reinforcements.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Leaders.The Helmsman.Descr.value: Le ACTION: Choose 1 system that does not contain other players' ships; you may move your flagship and any number of your dreadnoughts from other systems into the chosen system.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Promissories.Cybernetic En.value: Le At the start of your turn:
Remove 1 token from the L1Z1X player's strategy pool and return it to their reinforcements. Then, place 1 command token from your reinforcements in your strategy pool.
Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.
Le When you gain command tokens during the status phase:
Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Techs.Inheritance Systems..value: Le You may exhaust this card and spend 2 resources when you research a technology; ignore all of that technology's prerequisites.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Techs.Super-Dreadnought II.value: Le "Direct Hit" cards are no longer effective against this type of ship.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Units.Annihilator.Descript.value: Le While not participating in ground combat, this unit can use its BOMBARDMENT ability on planets in its system as if it were a ship.

L1Z1X Mindnet.Units.[0.0.1].Description.value: Le During a space combat, hits produced by this ship and by your dreadnoughts in this system must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.

LYA+Dm.value: Le Select all factions and colors

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Edict.De.value: Le When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent's reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1 of that player's tokens; other player's tokens in your fleet pool increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Hubris.D.value: Le During setup, purge your "Alliance" promissory note. Other players cannot give you their "Alliance" promissory note.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Abilities.Imperia..value: Le While another player's command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player's commander, if it is unlocked.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Leaders.Airo Shir.value: Le ACTION: Move all units in the space area of any system to an adjacent system that contains a different player's ships. Space Combat is resolved in that system; neither player can retreat or resolve abilities that would move their ships

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Leaders.Il Na Viro.value: Le During your tactical actions, you can activate systems that contain your command tokens. If you do, return both command tokens to your reinforcements and end your turn.
Le Have 2 other factions' command tokens in your fleet pool.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Leaders.Jae Mir Ka.value: Le When you would spend a command token during the secondary ability of a strategic action:
You may exhaust this card to remove 1 of the active player's command tokens from the board and use it instead.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Promissories.Scept.value: Le At the start of the strategy phase:
Choose 1 non-home system that contains your units; each other player who has a token on the Mahact player's command sheet places a token from their reinforcements in that system
Then, return this card to the Mahact player.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Techs.Crimson Legi.value: Le After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good. Then, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Techs.Genetic Reco.value: Le You may exhaust this card before a player casts votes; that player must cast at least 1 vote for an outcome of your choice or remove 1 token from their fleet pool and return it to their reinforcements.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Arvicon Rex..value: Le During combat against an opponent whose command token is not in your fleet pool, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Crimson Legi.value: Le After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Mahact Gene-Sorcerers.Units.Starlancer.D.value: Le After a player whose command token is in your fleet pool activates this system, you may spend their token from your fleet pool to end their turn; they gain that token.

Mentak Coalition.Abilities.Ambush.Descri.value: Le At the start of a space combat, you may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value, produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of their ships.

Mentak Coalition.Abilities.Pillage.Descr.value: Le After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction, if they have 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of their trade goods or commodities.

Mentak Coalition.Leaders.Ipswitch, Loose.value: Le At the start of space combat that you are participating in:
You may purge this card; if you do, for each other player's ship that is destroyed during this combat, place 1 ship of that type from your reinforcements in the active system.

Mentak Coalition.Leaders.S'Ula Mentarion.value: Le After you win a space combat:
You may force your opponent to give you 1 promissory note from their hand.
Le Have 4 cruisers on the game board.

Mentak Coalition.Leaders.Suffi An.Descri.value: Le After the PILLAGE faction ability is used against another player:
You may exhaust this card; if you do, you and that player each draw 1 action card.

Mentak Coalition.Promissories.Promise of.value: Le ACTION: Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use their PILLAGE faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player's units, return this card to the Mentak player.

Mentak Coalition.Techs.Mirror Computing..value: Le When you spend trade goods, each trade good is worth 2 resources or influence instead of 1.

Mentak Coalition.Techs.Salvage Operation.value: Le After you win or lose a space combat, gain 1 trade good; if you won the combat you may also produce 1 ship in that system of any ship type that was destroyed during the combat.

Mentak Coalition.Units.Fourth Moon.Descr.value: Le Other players' ships in this system cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Mentak Coalition.Units.Moll Terminus.Des.value: Le Other players' ground forces on this planet cannot use SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Naalu Collective.Abilities.Foresight.Des.value: Le After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, you may place 1 token from your strategy pool in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

Naalu Collective.Abilities.Telepathic.De.value: Le At the end of the strategy phase, place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Descript.value: Le You may produce 1 additional fighter for their cost; these additional units do not count against your production limit.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Omega.De.value: You may look at your neighbours' hand of promissory notes and the top and bottom card of the agenda deck.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Omega.Un.value: Le Have ground forces in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.M'aban.Unlock.value: Le Have 12 fighters on the game board.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.The Oracle.Desc.value: Le At the end of the status phase:
You may force each other player to give you 1 promissory note from their hand. If you do, purge this card.

Naalu Collective.Leaders.Z'eu.Descriptio.value: Le After an agenda is revealed:
You may exhaust this card to look at the top card of the agenda deck. Then, you may show that card to 1 other player

Naalu Collective.Leaders.Z'eu.Omega.Desc.value: Le ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose a player; that player may perform a tactical action in a non-home system without placing a command token; that system still counts as being activated

Naalu Collective.Promissories.Gift of Pr.value: Le At the end of the strategy phase:

Place this card face-up in your play area and place the Naalu "0" token on your strategy card; you are first in the initiative order. The Naalu player cannot use their TELEPATHIC faction ability during this game round.
Return this card to the Naalu player at the end of the status phase.

Naalu Collective.Techs.Hybrid Crystal Fi.value: Le This unit may move without being transported. Each fighter in excess of your ships' capacity counts as 1/2 of a ship against your fleet pool

Naalu Collective.Techs.Neuroglaive.Descr.value: Le After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, that player removes 1 token from their fleet pool and returns it to their reinforcements.

Naalu Collective.Units.Iconoclast.Descri.value: Le During combat against an opponent who has at least 1 relic fragment, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.

Naalu Collective.Units.Iconoclast.Omega..value: Le Other players cannot use ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE against your units in this system.

Naalu Collective.Units.Matriarch.Descrip.value: Le During an invasion in this system, you may commit fighters to planets as if they were ground forces. When combat ends, return those units to the space area.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Abilities.Distant Su.value: Le When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs, you may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Abilities.Fabricatio.value: Le ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic; or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Leaders.Dart and Tai.value: Le After you gain control of a planet that was controlled by another player:

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Leaders.Garv and Gun.value: Le At the end of a player's turn:
You may exhaust this card to allow that player to explore 1 of their planets.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Leaders.Hesh and Pri.value: Le ACTION: Gain 1 relic and perform the secondary ability of up to 2 readied or unchosen strategy cards; during this action, spend command tokens from your reinforcements instead of your strategy pool.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Promissories.Black M.value: Le ACTION: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic.
Then return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Techs.Pre-Fab Arcolo.value: Le After you explore a planet, ready that planet.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Techs.Supercharge.De.value: Le At the start of a combat round, you may exhaust this card to apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Eidolon.Descri.value: Le If this unit is in the space area of the active system at the start of a space combat, flip this card.
(This card begins the game with this side face up)

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Visz el Vir.De.value: Le Your mechs in this system roll 1 additional die during combat.

Naaz-Rokha Alliance.Units.Z-Grav Eidolon.value: Le If this unit is in the space area of the active system, it is also a ship. At the end of a space battle in the active system, flip this card.
(This card begins the game with this side face down)

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Galactic Threat.De.value: Le You cannot vote on agendas. Once per agenda phase, after an agenda is revealed, you may predict aloud the outcome of that agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 technology that is owned by a player who voted how you predicted.

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Propagation.Descri.value: Le You cannot research technology. When you would research a technology, gain 3 command tokens instead.

Nekro Virus.Abilities.Technological Sing.value: Le Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed, you may gain 1 technology that is owned by that player.

Nekro Virus.Leaders.Nekro Acidos.Descrip.value: Le After you gain a technology:

Nekro Virus.Leaders.Nekro Acidos.Unlock.value: Le Own 3 technologies. A "Valefar Assimilator" technology counts only if its X or Y token is on a technology.

Nekro Virus.Leaders.Nekro Malleon.Descri.value: You may exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may discard 1 action card or spend 1 command token from their command sheet to gain 2 trade goods.

Nekro Virus.Leaders.UNIT.DSGN.FLAYESH.De.value: Le ACTION: Choose a planet that has a technology specialty in a system that contains your units. Destroy any other player's units on that planet. Gain trade goods equal to that planet's combined resource and influence values and gain 1 technology that matches the specialty of that planet.

Nekro Virus.Promissories.Antivirus.Descr.value: Le At the start of a combat:
Place this card face-up in your play area.
While this card is in your play area, the Nekro player cannot use their TECHNOLOGICAL SINGULARITY faction ability against you.
If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Nekro player's units, return this card to the Nekro player.

Nekro Virus.Units.Mordred.Description.value: Le During combat against an opponent who has an "X" or "Y" token on 1 or more of their technologies, apply +2 to the result of each of this unit's combat rolls.

Nekro Virus.Units.The Alastor.Descriptio.value: Le At the start of a space combat, choose any number of your ground forces in this system to participate in that combat as if they were ships.

Nomad.Abilities.Future Sight.Description.value: Le During the Agenda phase, after an outcome that you voted for or predicted is resolved, gain 1 trade good.

Nomad.Abilities.The Company.Description.value: Le During setup, take the 2 additional Nomad faction agents and place them next to your faction sheet; you have 3 agents.

Nomad.Leaders.Ahk-Syl Siven.Description.value: Le ACTION: Place this card near the game board; your flagship and units it transports can move out of systems that contain your command tokens during this game round
At the end of that game round, purge this card

Nomad.Leaders.Artuno the Betrayer.Descri.value: Le When you gain trade goods from the supply:
You may exhaust this card to place an equal number of trade goods on this card. When this card readies, gain the trade goods on this card.
